newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy energy watchdog rejects Enel tariff request.
newsitem.headline: Italy energy watchdog rejects Enel tariff request.

text.p: Italy's energy sector watchdog has rejected a request by state electricity utility Enel for a rise in tariffs this year of 10 lire per kWh, Sergio Garriba, one of the three authority officials, said on Friday.

Garriba, announcing the decision on electricity tariffs, said Enel would have raised around two trillion lire from the rise in prices under an old price mechanism, with the rises based mainly on imported fuel costs and other variables.
But the request had not been granted because a new tariff mechanism was being introduced, he said.
Enel, which made the request for tariff rises at the end of last year, says the request to update prices does not stem from criteria set under the old mechanism.
It says the request stems from the effect of fuel prices on international markets, as well as the growing costs imposed on the utility for purchases made from private energy producers.

The new mechanism, which simplifies the energy billing system, comes into force on July 1 and the chairman of the watchdog authority, Pippo Ranci, said the overall cost for the energy consumer will remain "substantially" unchanged.
